The '''Folde''' was a region in the centre of the realm of [[Rohan]], between the [[Westfold]] in the west, the [[White Mountains]] in the south and a line from the confluence of the river [[Snowbourn]] with the river [[Entwash]] running approximately south-west to the White Mountains in the east. The [[Eastfold]] lay beyond that line in the east.<ref name=Nomenclature>{{HM|N}}, entry '''Folde''', pp. 770-71</ref><ref name=Map>{{RK|Map}}</ref>

The Folde formed a part of the King's Lands.<ref name=Aldburg>{{UT|11b}}, footnote concerning Aldburg</ref> The town of [[Edoras]], the defensive centre of the Folde and the seat of the King<ref name=Nomenclature/> and Aldburg, the former seat of the King were located in the Folde<ref name=Aldburg/>..

==History==
The Folde was originally part of the realm of [[Gondor]] until in {{TA|2510}} the fief of [[Calenardhon]] was granted to [[Eorl]] the Young by the [[Ruling Steward]] of Gondor, [[Cirion]]. Thereafter the Folde was part of Rohan.<ref name=Eorl>{{UT|Eorl}}</ref> The first King of Rohan, Eorl the Young lived in a house in Aldburg. After his son Brego moved to Edoras, Aldburg passed into the hands of the third son of Brego, [[Eofor]] and his descendants.<ref name=Aldburg/>

During the [[War of the Ring]], [[Éomer]], the nephew of King [[Théoden]] of Rohan, who claimed to be descended from Eofor had his home in Aldburg.<ref>{{UT|11b}}, writings concerning the Marshals of the Mark, first paragraph</ref>

On March 6 and 7<ref>{{HM|RC}}, citing from the amended time scheme, p. 508</ref> [[Gandalf]] rode with [[Peregrin Took]] through the Folde on the road to [[Minas Tirith]].<ref>{{RK|MT}}, p. 747</ref>

On March 11 {{TA|3019}}<ref>{{HM|RC}}, p. 542</ref> the riders of Rohan led by their King [[Théoden]] travelled with [[Meriadoc Brandybuck]] through the Folde on their way to Minas Tirith.<ref>{{RK|Muster}}, p. 804</ref>

In early August {{TA|3019}}<ref>{{HM|RC}}, p. 641</ref> the funeral escort of King Théoden passed through the Folde on its way to [[Edoras]].<ref>{{RK|Partings}}, p. 976</ref>

==Etymology==
''Folde'' is a name in the language of Rohan, which is represented by [[Old English]]. ''Folde'' means "earth", "land", or "country" in Old English]].<ref name=Nomenclature/>
